answers.answer: Has the rheumatologist not diagnosed you with anything auto-immune?  You definitely do have something going on.  If that one won't help you get a 2nd opinion.  Unfortunately it can take a while for auto-immune issues to get properly diagnosed as the blood doesn't always reveal all when tested.  Keep going back until you get your answers.
All I know right now, is that all tests indicate something is going on, and possibly in the future dates, it will be discovered.

question: HiAs most of you well know, symptoms come and go and new ones pop up before a real diagnosis.I have had MANY problems for at least 15 years.  Started with hands and feet and ankles.I was sent to a rheumatologist.  the only test results I know are as follows:C-Reactive Protein  H   0.8Rheumatoid Factor         5TSH    2.995Sedimentation Rate  H   40Anti nuclear Antibody Screen     H    34Cyclic Citruliated Peptide Antibody   1Positive ANA & positive Anti-LA2 Schermer's tests were normalNow I have a red spot on my big toe, not huge, but like a little red lump.Diagnosed with neuropathy (upper limbs)Toes on rt foot turn blueish when coldTwo toes look glossy red now, like they had been burned.Brittle nails (toes more than hands)heels especially painful, they also feel swollen and turn red.Also red around the edges of the heels.Lots of itching.  Started in toes, now in arms and legs.Left wrist and arm thicker than rightstiffness in hands in feet and neck.now, I learn that uric acids higher than normal creating a chemical imbalance in blood.It seems to fit under gout and scleroderma.Do not know family history of these.  I know lupus, heart disorders, thyroid disorders, kidney disorders, diabetes.I have now been having rapid heart rate (avg 120) for long periods.  I have been out of it for a couple days...could not wake up, couldnt walk steady, slurring words, constant blinking of eyes in light and in dark.I have had frequesnt episodes of shingles.  And skin infections off and on.  And aometimes swelling around joints of ankles when standing long, and around knuckles of hands.Any ideas anyone?  I will try to get more information, but I just dont seem to be getting help.Thanks for any input you may have.I have fibromyalgia, depression, medullary kidney disease, diabetes, asthma, cervical rediculopathy, neuropathy, insomnia, GERDI take cymbalta 30 mg BID, Savella  50mg BID, trazadone 50mg (1-4 tabs at bedtime), Theophylline 450mg BID, Wellbutrin 300mg XL 1 daily, oxycodone Up to two tabs daily, Nexium 40 mg in AM, Vitamin D 800iu daily, multivitamin dailyThanks much.
title: Symptoms (new) & test results-pos ANA
